            title="Optional">
        <span id="launchtemplatespecification_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#launchtemplatespecification_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Specification</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverridelaunchtemplatespecification">Property Map</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Nested argument defines the Launch Template. Defined below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="weightedcapacity_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#weightedcapacity_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">weighted<wbr>Capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Number of capacity units, which gives the instance type a proportional weight to other instance types.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

        <span id="allowedinstancetypes_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedinstancetypes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allowed<wbr>Instance<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#networkinterfacecount_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverrideinstancerequirementsnetworkinterfacecount">Group<wbr>Mixed<wbr>Instances<wbr>Policy<wbr>Launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Override<wbr>Instance<wbr>Requirements<wbr>Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block describing the minimum and maximum number of network interfaces. Default is no minimum or maximum.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">On<wbr>Demand<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requirehibernatesupport_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requirehibernatesupport_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Require<wbr>Hibernate<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Spot<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="totallocalstoragegb_csharp">

            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedinstancetypes_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedinstancetypes_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allowed<wbr>Instance<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverrideinstancerequirementsnetworkinterfacecount">Group<wbr>Mixed<wbr>Instances<wbr>Policy<wbr>Launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Override<wbr>Instance<wbr>Requirements<wbr>Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block describing the minimum and maximum number of network interfaces. Default is no minimum or maximum.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">On<wbr>Demand<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requirehibernatesupport_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requirehibernatesupport_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Require<wbr>Hibernate<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Spot<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="totallocalstoragegb_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#totallocalstoragegb_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Total<wbr>Local<wbr>Storage<wbr>Gb</a>

        <span id="allowedinstancetypes_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedinstancetypes_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Instance<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverrideinstancerequirementsnetworkinterfacecount">Group<wbr>Mixed<wbr>Instances<wbr>Policy<wbr>Launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Override<wbr>Instance<wbr>Requirements<wbr>Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block describing the minimum and maximum number of network interfaces. Default is no minimum or maximum.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">on<wbr>Demand<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Integer</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requirehibernatesupport_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requirehibernatesupport_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">require<wbr>Hibernate<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">spot<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Integer</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="totallocalstoragegb_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#totallocalstoragegb_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">total<wbr>Local<wbr>Storage<wbr>Gb</a>

        <span id="allowedinstancetypes_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedinstancetypes_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Instance<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverrideinstancerequirementsnetworkinterfacecount">Group<wbr>Mixed<wbr>Instances<wbr>Policy<wbr>Launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Override<wbr>Instance<wbr>Requirements<wbr>Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block describing the minimum and maximum number of network interfaces. Default is no minimum or maximum.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">on<wbr>Demand<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requirehibernatesupport_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requirehibernatesupport_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">require<wbr>Hibernate<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">spot<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="totallocalstoragegb_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#totallocalstoragegb_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">total<wbr>Local<wbr>Storage<wbr>Gb</a>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowed_instance_types_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowed_instance_types_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed_<wbr>instance_<wbr>types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupmixedinstancespolicylaunchtemplateoverrideinstancerequirementsnetworkinterfacecount">Group<wbr>Mixed<wbr>Instances<wbr>Policy<wbr>Launch<wbr>Template<wbr>Override<wbr>Instance<wbr>Requirements<wbr>Network<wbr>Interface<wbr>Count</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block describing the minimum and maximum number of network interfaces. Default is no minimum or maximum.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="on_demand_max_price_percentage_over_lowest_price_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#on_demand_max_price_percentage_over_lowest_price_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">on_<wbr>demand_<wbr>max_<wbr>price_<wbr>percentage_<wbr>over_<wbr>lowest_<wbr>price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="require_hibernate_support_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#require_hibernate_support_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">require_<wbr>hibernate_<wbr>support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spot_max_price_percentage_over_lowest_price_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#spot_max_price_percentage_over_lowest_price_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">spot_<wbr>max_<wbr>price_<wbr>percentage_<wbr>over_<wbr>lowest_<wbr>price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedinstancetypes_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Instance<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes. You can use strings with one or more wild cards, represented by an asterisk (*), to allow an instance type, size, or generation. The following are examples: <code>m5.8xlarge</code>, <code>c5*.*</code>, <code>m5a.*</code>, <code>r*</code>, <code>*3*</code>. For example, if you specify <code>c5*</code>, you are allowing the entire C5 instance family, which includes all C5a and C5n instance types. If you specify <code>m5a.*</code>, you are allowing all the M5a instance types, but not the M5n instance types. Maximum of 400 entries in the list; each entry is limited to 30 characters. Default is all instance types.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> If you specify <code>allowed_instance_types</code>, you can't specify <code>excluded_instance_types</code>.</p>
</blockquote>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ondemandmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">on<wbr>Demand<wbr>Max<wbr>Price<wbr>Percentage<wbr>Over<wbr>Lowest<wbr>Price</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for an On-Demand Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 20.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requirehibernatesupport_yaml">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicate whether instance types must support On-Demand Instance Hibernation, either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. Default is <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="spotmaxpricepercentageoverlowestprice_yaml">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Price protection threshold for Spot Instances. This is the maximum you’ll pay for a Spot Instance, expressed as a percentage higher than the cheapest M, C, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling selects instance types with your attributes, we will exclude instance types whose price is higher than your threshold. The parameter accepts an integer, which Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling interprets as a percentage. To turn off price protection, specify a high value, such as 999999. Default is 100.</p>
<p>If you set DesiredCapacityType to vcpu or memory-mib, the price protection threshold is applied based on the per vCPU or per memory price instead of the per instance price.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

<h4 id="grouptag">Group<wbr>Tag</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="key_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#key_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Key</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="propagateatlaunch_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#propagateatlaunch_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Propagate<wbr>At<wbr>Launch</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Enables propagation of the tag to
Amazon EC2 instances launched via this ASG</p>
<p>To declare multiple tags, additional <code>tag</code> blocks can be specified.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>NOTE:</strong> Other AWS APIs may automatically add special tags to their associated Auto Scaling Group for management purposes, such as ECS Capacity Providers adding the <code>AmazonECSManaged</code> tag. These generally should be included in the configuration so the provider does not attempt to remove them and so if the <code>min_size</code> was greater than zero on creation, that these tag(s) are applied to any initial EC2 Instances in the Auto Scaling Group. If these tag(s) were missing in the Auto Scaling Group configuration on creation, affected EC2 Instances missing the tags may require manual intervention of adding the tags to ensure they work properly with the other AWS service.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="value_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#value_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Value</a>

These generally should be included in the configuration so the provider does not attempt to remove them and so if the <code>min_size</code> was greater than zero on creation, that these tag(s) are applied to any initial EC2 Instances in the Auto Scaling Group. If these tag(s) were missing in the Auto Scaling Group configuration on creation, affected EC2 Instances missing the tags may require manual intervention of adding the tags to ensure they work properly with the other AWS service.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="value_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#value_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Value</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="grouptrafficsource">Group<wbr>Traffic<wbr>Source</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="identifier_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#identifier_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Identifier</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Identifies the traffic source. For Application Load Balancers, Gateway Load Balancers, Network Load Balancers, and VPC Lattice, this will be the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a target group in this account and Region. For Classic Load Balancers, this will be the name of the Classic Load Balancer in this account and Region.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="type_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#type_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Provides additional context for the value of Identifier.
The following lists the valid values:
<code>elb</code> if <code>identifier</code> is the name of a Classic Load Balancer.
<code>elbv2</code> if <code>identifier</code> is the ARN of an Application Load Balancer, Gateway Load Balancer, or Network Load Balancer target group.
<code>vpc-lattice</code> if <code>identifier</code> is the ARN of a VPC Lattice target group.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="groupwarmpool">Group<wbr>Warm<wbr>Pool</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="instancereusepolicy_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#instancereusepolicy_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Instance<wbr>Reuse<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupwarmpoolinstancereusepolicy">Group<wbr>Warm<wbr>Pool<wbr>Instance<wbr>Reuse<wbr>Policy</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Whether instances in the Auto Scaling group can be returned to the warm pool on scale in. The default is to terminate instances in the Auto Scaling group when the group scales in.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxgrouppreparedcapacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxgrouppreparedcapacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Group<wbr>Prepared<wbr>Capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Total maximum number of instances that are allowed to be in the warm pool or in any state except Terminated for the Auto Scaling group.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="minsize_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#minsize_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Min<wbr>Size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Minimum number of instances to maintain in the warm pool. This helps you to ensure that there is always a certain number of warmed instances available to handle traffic spikes. Defaults to 0 if not specified.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="poolstate_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#poolstate_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Pool<wbr>State</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Sets the instance state to transition to after the lifecycle hooks finish. Valid values are: Stopped (default), Running or Hibernated.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

        <span class="property-type"><a href="#groupwarmpoolinstancereusepolicy">Group<wbr>Warm<wbr>Pool<wbr>Instance<wbr>Reuse<wbr>Policy</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Whether instances in the Auto Scaling group can be returned to the warm pool on scale in. The default is to terminate instances in the Auto Scaling group when the group scales in.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="max_group_prepared_capacity_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#max_group_prepared_capacity_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">max_<wbr>group_<wbr>prepared_<wbr>capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Total maximum number of instances that are allowed to be in the warm pool or in any state except Terminated for the Auto Scaling group.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="min_size_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#min_size_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">min_<wbr>size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Minimum number of instances to maintain in the warm pool. This helps you to ensure that there is always a certain number of warmed instances available to handle traffic spikes. Defaults to 0 if not specified.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="pool_state_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#pool_state_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">pool_<wbr>state</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Sets the instance state to transition to after the lifecycle hooks finish. Valid values are: Stopped (default), Running or Hibernated.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="yaml">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Auto Scaling Groups using the `name`. For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:autoscaling/group:Group web web-asg
```
